form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR BUREAU OF EMPLOYMENT SECURITY, Form ES-575B

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 In REPLY REFER RECD T/C JAN 14 1969 TO Phone No. U. S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR 556-5624 BUREAU OF EMPLOYMENT SECURITY 450 Golden Gate Avenue, Room 10343 P. O. Box 36017 UNITED STATES EMPLOYMENT SERVICE San Francisco, California 94102 UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE SERVICE DATE: January 10, 1969 District Director Immigration & Naturalization Service FILE NO'S - A17 195 429 Attention: T/20 A17 195 430 TC/I-140 300 North Los Angeles Street Los Angeles, California REVALIDATION EMPLOYER:Mr. & Mrs. Nathaniel Paschall Re: Application for Alien Employment Certification for nui CHAN and Chuen LAU The Department of Labor has made a determination in the above request. Final action has been taken as follows: XXX Form ES-575 has been certified and is enclosed with the supporting documents. All enclosures should be submitted to the Immigration and Naturalization Service District Office either with your petition (Form I-140) or for consideration of alien's application for adjustment of status. 2. Form ES-575 has been certified and forwarded to the Consulate at which the alien has indicated he will file a visa application. The Con- sular Officer will inform the alien of the additional documents to be submitted and steps to be taken in order to apply for an immigrant visa. 3. Form ES-575B has been certified and is enclosed. This letter and the certified form should accompany Forms ES-575A which you may subsequently file with the local office of the State Employment Service for aliens you desire to employ under this certification. 4. Form ES-575A has been favorably acted upon by the Department of Labor and is enclosed for submission to the Immigration and Naturalization Service or, if not enclosed, has been forwarded to the Consular office for further consideration under the previously certified job offer (Form ES-575B). 5. Form ES-575A could not be acted upon favorably by the Department of Labor for the reason indicated on the Form or given in the advisory statement attached to the Form which is enclosed for return to the alien. 6. On the basis of information available to us, we cannot issue the certification re- quired by Section 212 (a) (14) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, as amended. Reason: Available job market information will not warrant a certification of un- availability of workers in the U.S. Remarks: Sincerely yours, CC: Petitioner Certifying Officer CC: State ES-Agency BES FL 71-48 (Rev. 3-67) #008 U.S. GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE: 1960-295-248
